availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Williams (Hancock County carpenter and steam/flatboatman)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza J. Williams. Father of John H. Williams and James H. Williams. Private in the 4th Kentucky Infantry during the Mexican-American War from 1847 to 1848. Carpenter in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 125.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Town of Hawesville, p. 15.
Find A Grave, "John J. Willilams (October 14, 1828-March 21, 1911)," Memorial #75141521, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75141521 (accessed April 7, 2017).
